page.title: 05WALSALL'S TRANSPORT SYSTEM
page.content: {Walsall Bus Depot}garages{177 buses which cover{151}services. Of these 70 need daily servicing. They run on {diesel}fuel, doing about{27 Km/L. Public bus services are under threat of{privatisation.}The last trolley bus ran in 1970. { {Walsall B.R. Station }in the town centre runs return services to {Birmingham}for all other train connections. This operates from Monday to Saturday. The station closes on Sundays. {Walsall/Rushall canal}is{11 Km}long. It lies between{Birchills}and{Ryders {Green locks,}under the{British {Waterways Board.}About 16 barges pass through Walsall weekly. They must observe a{6 Km/h}speed limit. The canal provides for commercial and leisure use i.e. fishing, canoeing, walking and nature study.
